cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is described as having an impact on social interactions.
Body language is described as affecting interpersonal relationships.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: EffectScope: ongoing social or emotional bonds

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Awareness and observation of posture help individuals better understand the dynamics of their social interactions.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: by being mindful of and observing posture

remarks: Relation focuses on cognitive understanding rather than causing the interactions themselves.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language significantly affects how social interactions unfold.
Body language has a strong effect on interpersonal relationships.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject exerts a causal influence on how the object develops, unfolds, or is shaped, without implying strict determinism.
args.justification: All four relations describe body language having a causal impact on the quality and unfolding of social interactions or interpersonal relationships; they share the same direction (body language → interaction/relationship outcome) and semantics of causal influence.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject helps an observer better comprehend, interpret, or make sense of the object, focusing on cognitive understanding rather than causing the object itself.
args.justification: This relation explicitly concerns how observing posture helps individuals understand social interactions; it is epistemic/cognitive (facilitating understanding) rather than directly causing the interaction.
args.remark: Kept separate from generic causal 'influences' predicates to capture the cognitive/interpretive nature of the link.

args.justification: These relations all describe how nonverbal communication (body language) influences social outcomes such as interaction dynamics and relationship quality; grouping them under a shared class for influence on social outcomes improves schema coherence.
This relation captures how posture contributes to understanding social interactions, which is best modeled as a class about social perception and cognition rather than direct outcome influence.
All four relations describe body language as having a causal or quasi-causal impact (effect, influence) on social interactions or relationships, fitting a causality-oriented group.

The relation is about how posture helps people understand social interactions, which is primarily about perception and interpretation, fitting a broad cognition-oriented group rather than direct causal influence.
